thesis.description: "In the past decade there has developed one of the greatest booms in the history of neurology" (French, 1958b). This boom, involving the reticular system of the brain, has encompassed diverse fields of study, including psychology. Several symposia, numerous reviews and hundreds of papers devoted to this system emphasize its increasing popularity among those interested in cerebral function. The inclusion, in a recent introductory textbook of psychology (Hebb, 1958), of the roles which the reticular system may play in behavior, is an indication of its importance in present psychological thinking.
thesis.creator: Cooper, Roderick. M.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Nonspecific thalamic functions in learning.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In 1947 a mould was found growing as a contaminant on a Lowenstein's slope which had been inoculated with sputum for the isolation of Mycobacterium tuberculosis which was found to produce, in addition to an antibiotic probably identical with penicillin, a substance capable of neutralizing various bacterial exotoxins. (Diena, 1954, 1956; Murray, Denton, Stevenson and Diena, 1958). The mould was identified as Penicillium cyaneo-fulvum and the toxin neutralizing substance was designated noxiversin. Noxiversin was shown to possess, in addition to its antitoxic properties, some activity against influenza virus (Diena, 1956).
thesis.creator: Cooke, Patricia. M.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.
thesis.title: An antiviral substance from penicillium cyaneo-fulvum.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Glutamine was first isolated from beet juice in 1883 by Schulze and Bosshard (1), and since that time it has been the subject of continued interest and research. The widespread occurence of this amide in nature, in bath the free and combined state, is consistent with a significant metabolic role, and there is evidence for its participation in a variety of enzymatic reactions.
thesis.creator: Coles, Norman. W.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Glutamine metabolism in Ehrlich ascites carcinoma cells.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: As we stubbornly search for beginnings we are forced to content ourselves with the recognition of significant middles. One man's enmity can change the course of history, and in the seventeenth century one man’s humanitarianism changed the outlook of an age. Brahe, Kepler and Gilbert had understood the advances of science better than he, and had known the value of repeated observation. Other dreamers had the idea of a co-operative group of scientists. The push came not directly from science but from social reform and it was Francis Bacon who understood the pessimism of his time and where the stumbling-blocks lay.
thesis.creator: Cleghorn, Sheena.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: Four diarists and the new science of the seventeenth century.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The fundamental problem in the nutrition of any organism (animal, plant or microbe), according to Porter (1946), is the construction of a medium, or diet, of known composition which will permit optimum growth and reproduction. With bacteria this problem has led to the development of chemically defined or synthetic media, that is, media composed of known purified chemicals. The advantages of protein free synthetic media for biochemical study were appreciated early in the history of bacteriology.
thesis.creator: Cheuk, Shu. F.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.
thesis.title: Nutritional and other studies of nephrotoxin-producing streptococci.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this thesis is to investigate the performance, operating characteristics and stability of the vacuum system which has already been built to meet the requirement of the hypersonic wind-tunnel. For relating the operating variables of steam ejectors, a formula is derived for general use. [...]
thesis.creator: Cheng, Lung.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Operation of Steam Ejectors in Series.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The condensation of superheated vapors is an important process which is encountered frequently in industry. For example, products which are produced by vapor phase reactions often involve a step in which a superheated vapor must be condensed. The ammonia synthesis and oxidation processes are typical examples of this case. [...]
thesis.creator: Chen, Bih-Hwa.
thesis.subject: Chemical Engineering.
thesis.title: Dropwise Condensation of Saturated and Superheated Steam Outside a Vertical Tube.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Considerable interest has developed in birdsfoot trefoil as a forage legume in certain areas of North America. The greatest attention has centered on broadleaf birdsfoot trefoil (Lotus corniculatus L.) although other related species including big or marsh trefoil (L. uliginosus Schkuhr) and narrowleaf trefoil (L. tenuis Wald. et Kit.) have special qualities that make them of interest under some conditions. [...]
thesis.creator: Chamberlain, Alice Chen.
thesis.subject: Agronomy.
thesis.title: Classification of Agronomic Types in Lotus Corniculatus L. and Related Species.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of the present work is to investigate the growth of authigenic feldspars in sediments, more specifically in shales. Authigenic feldspars have been discussed frequently in the literature, but most of these discussions have been descriptive, and little information as to their probable mode of origin has been published. [...]
thesis.creator: Chagnon, Jean-Yves
thesis.subject: Geological Science.
thesis.title: An experimental Study of the Growth of Feldspars in Sediments
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The physico-chemical changes that take place during the coagulation of milk by the enzyme rennin are not fully understood. Aside from such factors as calcium ion concentration, temperature, and pH, the peculiar constitution of casein is also believed to play a major role in the coagulation process.
thesis.creator: Cayen, Mitchell N.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies on the Flavour and on the Carbohydrate Moiety of Casein.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The title of this thesis would suggest a two-fold study, but in reality there is one continuous story. Lower Canada College would never have come into existence without St. John the Evangelist's School as its matrix. As will be shown the birth of one caused the death of the other. [...]
thesis.creator: Caverhill, Austin.
thesis.subject: Education.
thesis.title: a History of St. John's School and Lower Canada College.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Tessiarsuk, or Salt Water Pond as it is called locally, has been known and intermittently fished for many years by the inhabitants of Nain. Although scant interest is shown in this unique body of water during the summer months when cod become so plentiful in the fjords, periodic expeditions are made overland in winter to jig through the ice for the large, if relatively scarce, Gadus callarias. [...]
thesis.creator: Carter, John C.H.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: a Preliminary Ecological Study of a Meromictic Lake in Northern Labrador.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Nordstrom theory of gravitation is sketched and possible modifications of the field equations are examined under the double requirement that the theory admits an energy-momentum tensor, as well as predicts the proper precession for the orbit of a planet. The possibility of red shift and bending of light rays in such a theory is also mentioned.
thesis.creator: Carbotte, Jules.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: Scalar Gravitational Theories Within Special Relativity.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: For purposes of mechanistic study and structural assignment in organic chemistry it is often of great practical value to possess some knowledge concerning the basic strengths of various functional groups. The present work will concern itself primarily with a study of the basic strength of the carbonyl group as it occurs in two main classes of organic compounds - ketones and amides. [...]
thesis.creator: Campbell, Hugh J.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies on the Protonation of Some Organic Compounds.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Verticillium wilt is often the cause of serious losses in potatoes in Eastern Canada and Northern United States. It is of minor importance in field tomatoes except in California and Utah. The disease is not uncommon in greenhouse tomatoes in North America and in Europe. [...]
thesis.creator: Campbell, J. Ewen.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: the Physiology of Verticillium Wilt of Tomato and Potato.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The position of Edmund Wilson is unique among critics on the American literary scene. For over three decades he has been considered one of America's leading critics of literature and is doubtless, as Stanley Edgar Hyman observes, "the most widely known of our critics." [...]
thesis.creator: Butovsky, Mervin.
thesis.subject: English.
thesis.title: Tradition and Isolation: the Literary Criticism of Edmund Wilson.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It was proposed to make an investigation of the terrestrial heat flow in the area about Montreal using boreholes drilled to explore for gas or oil. A fairly satisfactory D.C. thermistor bridge method of measuring temperatures at depth has been developed and three boreholes have been surveyed.
thesis.creator: Butler, Richard B.
thesis.subject: Geological Science.
thesis.title: Terrestrial Heat Flow in the St. Lawrence Lowland of Quebec

thesis.description: On the basis of Biblical theology the Church is meant to be a community church. In the Old Testament the Church is the "people of God", Israel, a community of people, chosen by the act of God. The Suffering Servant of the Lord in Deutero-Isaiah represents in his one person the community of those faithful to God, the Remnant, the true Israel. [...]
thesis.creator: Buck, John M.
thesis.subject: Divinity.
thesis.title: the "Community Church" and Church Union.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Psychological theory and experimentation have generally been concerned with the relation between simple stimulus events and responses. Typically, however, a response to a stimulus is not an isolated bit of behavior, but one incident in a long series of responses. In behavior such as speech or piano playing, for example, the important factor is not the single response, but the response in its temporal relation to others. [...]
thesis.creator: Bryden, Mark Philip.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Tachistoscopic Perception and Serial Order.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: When medically important fungi were first studied, some pathogenic fungi which were unicellular in vivo were found to change to a mycelial form when cultured. This change in morphology was misleading as investigators believed they were not isolating the correct pathogenic organisms. The confusion continued until the pathogenic fungi were shown to change their morphology as a result of temperature changes. [...]
thesis.creator: Brown, Robert George.
thesis.subject: Agriculture Bacteriology.
thesis.title: a Physiological Comparison of the Dimorphic Forms of Pullularia Pullulans.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The early days of the French Revolution witnessed a sudden expansion of the popular press under conditions of complete freedom, and as national issues and party controversies developed, newspapers took up the cudgel of partisan strife. Mirabeau, Brissot, and Condorcet brought politics and journalism into the closest union. By October, 1789, three political groups clearly stood out in the National Assembly: the aristocrats, the moderates or "monarchiens", and the so-called patriots. [...]
thesis.creator: Brosseau, Maurice.
thesis.subject: History.
thesis.title: les Actes des Apotres a Re-Appraisal.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis describes the various tests which were carried out on 492 specimens of a Gaspe skarn to determine a number of the physical properties for this particular rock type.[...]
thesis.creator: Shih, Tso-min.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: The physical properties of a Gaspé skarn.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.name: Master of Engineering
degree.discipline: Department of Mining Engineering and Applied Geophysics

thesis.description: The petrology of an ultrametamorphic complex is described. High-grade migmatitic plagioclase gneisses and amphibolites, with quartzites and metamorphic pyroxenites, were intruded sub-concordantly by gabbro. These older rocks were intruded by magmatic plutons of pyroxene-microperthite quartz-monzonite, with hornblende-microperthite quartz-monzonite and migmatitic microcline granite. Late basic sills and granite dykes occur.
thesis.creator: Guy- Bray, J.V.
thesis.subject: Geological Science.
thesis.title: the Petrology of La Lievre Area Roberval County, Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In order that acoustical impulse noise may be studied to determine the relationship between the effects of the noise on man and his exposure, a detailed analysis of the noise is required. A technique was developed for obtaining the energy spectrum as a function of time for this type of noise. [...]
thesis.creator: Bradley, C.W.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: the Measurement and Analysis of Acoustical Impulse Noise.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The urbanization of the French Canadian parish, which took root in rural Quebec, can best be understood by realizing what the parish was like at the time when it became the social unit of French Canada and then tracing it through the various phases which it has taken in response to its environment There are many different types of parishes—ranging from the inclusive primary group in remote rural surroundings to the highly urbanized parish in a city like Montreal. What was the nature of the early social life in French Canada, where the dominant form of social grouping was to be the parish? Much has been written of the early French seigneurs-- the noblemen who came to the wilderness that was Canada, and who established their large estates, or seigneuries. But it is significant that this so-called superior class contributed little to the actual colonization of Canada, and left no lasting institution.[...]
thesis.creator: Lieff, Pearl Jacobs
thesis.subject: Parishes -- Québec (Province).
Urbanization -- Québec (Province)
Québec (Province) -- Social conditions.
thesis.title: The urbanization of the French Canadian parish
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
